summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to an FBI Special Agent, transmitting a subpoena seeking non-privileged materials regarding a transaction related to the purchase of an unspecified property (likely 'lkni' is a redaction or garbled text for a property or entity). The document demonstrates ongoing investigative activity by the SDNY in 2020.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, transmitting a subpoena to an FBI Special Agent regarding the purchase of a property/entity.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Recipient of the email and the attached subpoena, previously contacted about the purchase transaction.

connections.description: The AUSA is providing a subpoena to the FBI Special Agent as part of an ongoing investigation, indicating a law enforcement and prosecutorial working relationship.

events.title: Subpoena Transmission for Transaction Records
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails an FBI Special Agent to transmit a subpoena seeking non-privileged materials regarding a purchase transaction.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The Southern District of New York was actively issuing subpoenas in the Epstein investigation as of July 2020.
The subpoena sought non-privileged materials related to a purchase transaction (the specific property/entity is redacted or garbled as 'lkni').
The communication shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI in the investigation.
